intro: Matthiola pumilio, commonly known as the dwarf stock, is a small flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, featuring compact foliage and clusters of fragrant, white or pink flowers. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Matthiola pumilio is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
